headline: Best Ever Muffins
description: These muffins can be your starting point for a range of sweet and savory muffins, depending on what you add. From berries to bacon ‚Äî it's up to you!

video.description: Start with the basic recipe in this video, and add one of several different ingredients for a variety of different muffins to fit almost any occasion.
video.name: Best Ever Muffins Recipe

name: Best Ever Muffins

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line cups with paper liners.
Stir flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar together in a large bowl; make a well in the center.

Beat egg with a fork in a small bowl or 2-cup measuring cup; whisk in milk and oil. Pour egg mixture all at once into flour mixture; mix quickly and lightly with a fork until just moistened. The batter will be lumpy. (Fold in additional ingredients if using; see variations below). Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full.
Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Quick and easy.. and tasty.. love them
They turned out perfectly ü•∞. I'm so happy I finally found this recipe that doesn't use yogurt or sour cream lol.

Ease? 5 stars. Which IS admittedly something I wanted. But flavour?? 2stars! I added blueberries. These need so much more IMO. The base batter ‚Äî well, I didn‚Äôt realize it was *just* a base. Like Primer before you paint. These muffins are Primer White, and trying to add nuts or berries is like flinging paint at the wall, hoping it will magically give you full coverage. It will not. So - maybe add some additional spices, or different flour‚Ä¶. But then? You‚Äôre probably looking for a different recipe, it turns out. I‚Äôm gonna follow ‚Äúivandiepart‚Äôs‚Äù review and try the best of the best blueberry muffins next I guess.
Came out super great I added vanilla essence and raisins my son loves it.
I love this recipe. Sometimes I press fresh blueberries into the top of the dough. Another time, I added pre-cooked Kirkland bacon and cheddar cheese on top. I call these "never fail" muffins.

I have been using this recipe for several years and was shocked to see people saying it didn‚Äôt work for them. I‚Äôve never had a problem, it‚Äôs delicious! I even make it gluten free and it‚Äôs so so good! It‚Äôs my base for every recipe, I‚Äôve done blueberries, chocolate chip, strawberries, cranberries, and I‚Äôve even turned it into a loaf several times! My husband and I love it, it will always be my go to!
I thought the liquid to dry ingredients was off, but continued with the recipe as is. To me, it was more like pancake batter. It was tasty but very heavy when baked.
Sorry but I found these muffins to be very bland and dense.

The muffins were really good I just would not say they were the best ever I taste just like any other muffins you would make but I would make this again the first time I made this I tried it with blueberries and pretty good the sec time I made it this I did chocolate chip and it WAS SO GOOOOOD now with the chocolate chips they are the BEST EVER MUFFINS I'm telling you would be forever on this shittt frfr
I thought the muffins were good. I'm going to make them again.
This is so easy to follow thanks heaps

Excellent basic recipe. I added one mashed banana & pecans. It made 8 Large muffin top muffins! 25 min to cook. If your muffins were too done, were you making small muffins? You need to adjust your cooking time. Next time I'll make blueberry muffins,

Was a awesome and versatile I ran out of eggs so I used a tbsp of apple cider vinegar and a half a tap of baking soda and it came out perfect Threw some flax and chia seeds in there and some pats and berries and used Splenda so my diabetic family member could have them also loved it.. Like it so much I created an account just to save it
We added banana and nuts! Made 6 large muffins with leftover for pancakes. Topped with butter when hot!

Such a versatile yet basic recipe! You can do any variation of muffins with this recipe. Don't doubt the instructions, just trust the process. I did mine with frozen strawberries, added a TSP of vanilla, and topped them with walnuts. SO DELICIOUS!
It was fantastic and Delicious I acually baked it and when i tasted it was amazing Although my aunty was asking if they were cooked and did not understand but so far it was fantabulous
This was great! For extra sweetness, I put in a teaspoon of honey, a teaspoon of almond extract, and a mashed banana. Added a bunch of chocolate chips, then baked them at 425 to brown them faster :)

This recipe was great! I pulled them out of the oven and was a little concerned beacause they looked a little burnt after 25 minutes. But once I ate them, they turned out delicious! The whole family LOVED them! Definitely will be using it again

These muffins are the best! They taste amazing and were baked to perfection! This is my now go-to muffin recipe! They are very simple and easy to make and are a great basic base that you can add so many things to! I added chocolate chips to mine and they were so good! Highly recommend!
No changes needed
i added gluten free all purpose flour, since i cant have regular flour, and added raisins to it, they tasted so great, i like this recipe, its so simple to use and add other stuff to it
It's such an easy recipe you can practically add almost a cup of anything to. I love it!
It's exactly what I was looking in a muffin mix. One I could add extras. I added a five grain granola, cinnamon and vanilla. Also I topped it with granola.
made as written and added blueberries. good basic recipe but definitely needs additions to make tasty muffins. without the blueberries these would have been too bland.

Apr 23, 2022 This is definitely more suitable for a savory breakfast muffin. Maybe bacon cheddar. I made apple cinnamon. They tasted fine but the texture was not what I look for in a muffin. I wanted more of a fluffy crumb like texture and that's not what this muffin recipe is. Good but not my go to recipe. üëç
This recipe is amazing!!!! I used Extra Virgin Olive Oil instead of vegetable oil and they were AWESOME. I would do way more stars if I could
Excellent texture and taste
Great recipe! I used half brown sugar and half white sugar. Added chocolate chips to one batch and blueberries to another batch. My family loved these!
I'm 16 and this was my first homemade desert experience, me and my mum made this recipe together and boy let me tell you , they were amazing! loved it!!
These were delicious definitely saving the recipe i made with canned blue berries drained bc I didn't have fresh.
I added cherries and chocolate chips. It was fast, simple, and delicious.

This recipe is easy and works well when converting it to vegan. I used vegan egg and almond milk to replace the non-vegan ingredients. Then after making the base batter I added 2 apples and 1 tsp. cinnamon to half the batter. The other half I added 1/2 cup of crunchy peanut butter. Both turned out moist and yummy.
Turned out great! I substituted the milk with almond milk and vegetable oil with canola oil. Still tasted the same. It is great when you feel like making something without going to the store!

The muffin recipe itself was great, but baking for 25 minutes at 400 WAY overbaked my muffins. Yes, I know it says 'or until golden' but the suggested time is way off, since I did a second batch at 15 minutes that turned out great. I do have an oven thermometer by the way so that should not have been the issue. Addressing the variability more clearly by saying 15-25 minutes would have been much more helpful - would have helped alert me before I seriously toasted the bottoms of my first panful.
Awful recipe, the muffins were burnt and charred at the end of the 25 minutes. They also tasted like baking powder. Ewwww. Would not recommend

Horrid. Followed everything and they turned out extremely bad. First batch burnt to a crisp in only fifteen minutes and the second batch started to burn before the inside was even fully cooked. Not even the chocolate chips I added could make it anywhere close to edible. I‚Äôd recommend trying to find a different recipe.
Love these muffins!! I make these all the time with frozen blueberries. They freeze very well.
OMG so good! I added coconut extract and shredded coconut in it and my family LOVED IT!
Easy to do with children and when the batter is done you can add whatever you want to it we did , blueberries, strawberries , an banana nut muffins .

It was delicious! My family liked it as well. I do suggest cutting the baking time to around 15-20 minutes because mine got a little hard after baking it for 25 minutes. Overall, I loved this recipe and I‚Äôll have to make them again!

These were so easy to make. I added cinnamon. I Also added a cinnamon and sugar topping. It turned out delicious. i did baked them for only 
16 minutes. Perfect!

Used half the recipe . The muffins don't taste like muffins . If ur a Chinese u will know the texture is like Chinese prayer cake muffins . Not a favorite . It's thick n chewy and tough at the same time
I love this recipe I found that they were golden brown in about 15 min witch is realy convinient
Very plain and it didn't "poof" did not taste anything like regular muffins. Try adding a few drops of vanilla extract. Add more baking powder and more sugar maybe 2/4 cup. Overall pretty good!

They were okay, I did a cup of blueberries, they aren‚Äôt very sweet. They baked very very well though. The were nice and fluffy just not sweet enough. Next time I will toss my blueberries in powdered sugar before adding.

Good flavor. However, baking time is definitely not 25 minutes. Mine were done in 15 minutes. I added some cinnamon and nutmeg and sprinkled cinnamon sugar on top before baking. Also, I used cupcake papers in my cupcake pans and the recipe made 15 good sized muffins.
This recipe is so good! I love sweet things so I would add a bit more sugar next time‚Ä¶ I did it with 3/4 cup chocolate chip‚Ä¶ Yummy

based on my previous adventures this came out great. i used a mixture of half whole wheat and half rye flour and added in homemade pumpkin spice with essence, apples n currants. Reduced sugar to 1/4 cup. my batter was a little dry, i may have left it forba min after pouring the liquid into it trying to grab my fruits or maybe it needed a bit more liquid. it may not be the prettiest but I am happy with the result. i will remake it and adjust the liquid on it.
I used brown sugar because it's what I had in hand, muffins are too sweet. I'll have to reduce the sugar next time.
Love it I used self rising flour and inused chocolate chunks. Tastes really good and very easy to make
I made 12 mini and 6 large. Baked the minis for 12mins. Added 1 cup raisins and 1/2 cup frozen blueberrys. My kids loved them. Will definitely make again

Super easy, I doubled the recipe and substituted butter for the oil. 
I put frozen strawberries in half and blackberries in the other half and they turned out amazing.
Great! Will be my go to. Hubby loved the crisp crust the sugar gave. My hot stove is a bane; had to reduce by five minutes.

Pretty good recipe, you do need to put your own spin on it. A quick tip is so make sure all your ingredients are room temperature before adding them together, it starts activating the baking powder and you end up with a much better finished muffin. Also after you divy out the batter in the pan let them sit for 10-15 mins. This also helps them poof better during baking and the result is a fluffy tender muffin.
Quick, easy to follow recipe! Delish! I added a cup of raspberries and used homemade oatmilk..yumm

The store was out of blueberries, so I opted for raspberries. 1 cup of fresh raspberries folded in. Served with Cheesy Shrimp and Grits from this site and Ruby Red Mimosas (2/3 sparkling wine, 1/3 ruby red grapefruit juice, 3 raspberries floating on top).
Maffins with cheddar, onions and corns. I used less sugar and less oil. Excellent!
I added fresh blueberries to my batch. I would not say these are the best ever. It is basic muffin recipe. If made again, I might add a tsp of vanilla extract to boost the batter flavor.
Theyre really amazing, and my lil brother loves them. I added a cup of chopped strawberries and topped them with homemade strawberry frosting ??
It was a easy recipe but tasted amazing
First time I learned how to make them fluff up so much look so yummy need to whip cream topping
The amounts are completely off and I ended up with a bowl of something that resembles play-doh before I added near another cup of liquid to make it work.
These muffins are amazing I think they are better with chocolate chips
These muffins where hit! I used GF flour, added mini chocolate chips, blueberries, and a little bit of cinnamon. Yummy!!!
Oh my! I added some lemon zest and teseare 100% yummy! Just finished creating a lemon icing to go on top from a blueberry scone recipe on this site! Perfect muffins!
I made muffins according to this recipe and it turned out great, never got such delicious muffins and even the first time
They were the right consistency and you can truly add almost anything (in correct proportions), not to mention its so simple.

I loved it. Tweaked the recipe a bit - I only had 3/4 cup milk so I supplemented the difference with sour cream. Then I used coconut oil instead of vegetable oil. I also used half APF and half cake flour to get a softer crumb. Turned out super moist and flavorful. Thanks!

They are simple and easy to make and everyone I make them for seems to like them. They are super fluffy and the taste is amazing, too. I've tried them with chocolate chips and blueberries, both of them worked out great. 

But they do lose some fluffiness and become crumbly if you leave them out for too long. Best to eat them right away. 

Also, after 45 minutes, take the muffins out immediately. Not doing so can make them turn dark brown. They still taste good but they don't look good anymore.
Yes, and yes. I used a cup of dried cherries. They were great, also made jalapeno cheese family loved them. Great for a breakfast on the go!!!!
Just made these muffins great quick recipe I made a double batch of 2 dozen muffins a couple hours later me and my gf have 0 muffins and feel sick.
This was the best muffin recipe. The texture and the muffin top was perfect. I made 10 so they were bigger. I added one banana and cup frozen wild blueberries. Yummy
I added bananas to it and it tasted delightful

Toddler approved! Made these for my toddler with food allergies as a way to introduce baked milk into her diet (physician instructions). Since she eats incredibly healthy I substituted no sugar added applesauce for the oil and used Enjoy Life chocolate chips. So good! I think the applesauce makes it a little more dense but they‚Äôre DELICIOUS. I love that there are so many ways to be creative with this recipe and will absolutely continue to use it for the base in future muffins!
I added a cup of berry yogurt and chocolate sprinkles because that's all we had and I work at a school and the kida loved them, so yummy!
This is a keeper. A nice simple substitute for boxed mixes. Used raspberries and chocolate chips this time. The family approved. :)
Made this today with my 3yr old! She loved the experience and are three mini muffins! I added vanilla. Great recipe! Thanks!!
It was great...my first time
Very good and so easy to do.
They are really good and pretty easy to make. It‚Äôs a good recipe to make with kids. I made it with two toddlers and they had so much fun. For a eggless recipe I used one over ripe banana.
These muffins turn out great every time

Absolutely delicious. I've made them several times and everyone that tries them loves them too.

Last time I made them in a loaf pan, and honestly, I liked it better than when they were in muffin form. They took a while longer in the oven, but it was worth it.

I think the recipe is quick and great but I also found that 3 teaspoons of baking powder is too much. I added bananas to mine and they turned out great but I can taste the baking powder too much. Next time I'm gonna half it to 1.5 teaspoons of baking powder.
this recipe was good I substituted the one cup of all-purpose flour for coconut flour and the other with plain flour and added some almond extract with vanilla extract and used frozen fruit.

This turned out great! Not too sweet just how I like it! I added 1/2 tsp vanilla extract and 1/2 tsp almond extract, and 1 cup of sliced fresh cherries. Add a smidge of butter and these are the perfect breakfast muffin with tea or coffee! I‚Äôll be using the base of this recipe again with other fruits added!

This one is far the best muffin recipe I've ever made! so easy and the sweetness is perfect for my kids since they like only plain muffins. 

All the ingredients mostly I have them at home. This time I ran out of milk and oil so I substitute them with buttermilk and butter. It came out perfect! Thank you!

Very easy to make and the family loved them, my daughter and I made them together and had fun doing so. 
Thank you for a great recipe.

This muffin recipe is so good! I love it so much I have to make it every morning! Although, the batter always seems like never enough so for all the bakers who decided this recipe don‚Äôt add to much batter in each tin or else you won‚Äôt have any batter for the last couple of muffin tins. But other that that it is so delicious especially with frozen blueberries!
The best recipe ever, always doing different variations and today chocolate! Instead of milk adding 200 grams of plain yogurt and few spoons of milk in the end if need. Thank you
Great! I added raisins, choc chips and cornmeal to the mix. Glorious ??
Followed the recipe exactly and they burned. My bad for not keeping an eye on them. I set the timer for 25 mins but I should have checked it after 20 mins
Easy and delicious! I add some lemon zest
I love these muffins so much. I gave some to my friends. This is the best muffin recipe ever. I recommend!
looks the same tastes good and thier big muffins
AMAZING!!! Work great with walnuts or almonds! I added some coco powder to half of my mixture (to taste) and it was wonderful! Nothing I would change, and I can't wait to try it with blueberries!!!

I would recommend using at least a cup of sugar in this recipe as it is not sweet enough for my taste. Also the recipe calls for using a fork to mix the batter. Terrible idea. I ended up over mixing the batter in an attempt to combine all the flour and liquid. Use a spatula.
This recipe was great! I had to use a bit of coconut instead of flour because I didn‚Äôt have enough, so I added more vanilla extract and its great!
very yummy!! I didn't make any changes but turned out really good!!
